quote: Let's be reasonable and add an eighth day to the week that is devoted exclusively to reading.
author: Lena Dunham

quote: Someday is not a day of the week.
author: Janet Dailey

quote: Where are the quotes?
author: Yousef Yousef

quote: It wasn’t my day. My week. My month. My year. My life. God damn it.
author: Charles Bukowski,  Pulp

quote: Life itself is a quotation.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Always be wary of people who use quotes. I don't know who said that.' - Murdoc Niccals
author: Gorillaz,  Gorillaz: Rise of the Ogre

quote: Long week. Long month. Long life.
author: John Green,  Will Grayson, Will Grayson

quote: Inspirational quotes are dances of light that shine in dark places during your life.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: People that love quotes are those short on time, but long on big ideas.
author: Bruce Edwin

quote: Wednesday had come and gone in a single breath. As I dreamt of divine love, Picasso, and a vast field of gold, a new dawn had already begun.
author: Terry A. O'Neal

quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays

quote: Each day gives the opportunity for you to be treated right, to feel worthy, and to be successful. It’s a choice you have to make, a faith you have to embrace, and a standard you have to set.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It’s payday every day of the week with Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Guide

quote: The life of every man is a diary in which he means to write one story, and writes another; and his humblest hour is when he compares the volume as it is with what he vowed to make it.
author: J.M. Barrie,  The Little Minister

quote: I wish, when I was first born, the first thing I said was "Quote"so the last thing I said before I died would be "Unquote.
author: Steven Wright

quote: This must be Thursday,' said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer. 'I never could get the hang of Thursdays.
author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: I get asked to read new works a lot, in the hope that I will give a quotation and I will only give a 'puff' for a book I truly love.
author: Peter James

quote: Quote words that affirmall men and women are yourbrothers and sisters.
author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams

quote: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: ...God created the world in six days. On the seventh day, he rested. On the eighth day, he started getting complaints. And it hasn't stopped since.
author: James Scott Bell,  Sins of the Fathers

quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I'm not an inspirational quote kind of person.
author: Christine Teigen

quote: Quotes are made we to think, we have made a mistake so quotes will put us in the right way? (But can we understand them - is the best question)
author: Deyth Banger

quote: Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting.
author: John Green

quote: By necessity, by proclivity, and by delight, we all quote.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Every day is a journey filled with twists and turns. Every day, if you smile, you will feel alive, my son.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
author: Annie Dillard,  The Writing Life

quote: Each day is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift to Him.
author: T.D. Jakes,  Maximize the Moment: God's Action Plan For Your Life

quote: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: I have a self-made quote: Celebrate diversity, practice acceptance and may we all choose peaceful options to conflict.
author: Donzella Michele Malone

quote: Every quote is like a Picasso. The meaning is different for each person and half the admirers miss the true intent and twisted humor of it all.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: For the happiest life, days should be rigorously planned, nights left open to chance.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Weekends don't count unless you spend them doing something completely pointless.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: Who says life is fair, where is that written?
author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

quote: Each day is the scholar of yesterday.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Each day means a new twenty-four hours. Each day means everything's possible again. You live in the moment, you die in the moment, you take it all one day at a time.
author: Marie Lu,  Legend

quote: ‎A day in which I don't write leaves a taste of ashes.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: May you live every day of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Famous people steal my quotes all of the time without knowing; none of it is ever very interesting though.
author: Robert DeCoteau,  The New Days: The First Son

quote: I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Everyday of your life is a another lesson. If you learn the lesson well and apply it; whether positive or negative, you determine what happens in your tomorrow.
author: David Kofi Awusi

quote: Life consists of two days, one for you one against you. So when it's for you don't be proud or reckless, and when it's against you be patient, for both days are test for you.
author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

quote: Each new day is a blank page in the diary of your life. The secret of success is in turning that diary into the best story you possibly can.
author: Douglas Pagels

quote: There are two great days in a person's life - the day we are born and the day we discover why.
author: William Barclay

quote: [A] quotation is a handy thing to have about, saving one the trouble of thinking for oneself, always a laborious business."(The Record Lie)
author: A.A. Milne,  If I May

quote: Quotes ain’t all that useful. Fact is, there’s more concise ways to express what you’re feelin’, like screams and moans.
author: M.C. Humphreys

quote: I rather spend every Sunday of my life hanging off a cliff to rescue someone than spend one more time sitting in a pew next to hypocrites that talk about what they will do to better themselves and the world when they get around to it.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: #quote In the harshest conditions is when we know better the people around us. En las condiciones más duras es cuando conocemos mejor a las personas que nos rodean.
author: Juan Luis Ortiz Hidalgo,  Las mil vidas del profesor Bonham

quote: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain
